ygData.subject: Re: re:  gnome parties
ygData.msgSnippet: There s no place like Gnome, Gnome on the range, If you re happy and you Gnome it, Gnome-ody knows the trouble I see, Gnome sweet Gnome, Gnome for the
ygData.messageBody:
There's no place like Gnome, Gnome on the range, If you're happy and you
Gnome it, Gnome-ody knows the trouble I see, Gnome sweet Gnome, Gnome for
the holidays.

Tinik
Veeshan

----- Original Message -----
From: Andy Smith <AndyS@...>
To: <EQ_Tinkering@onelist.com>
Sent: Thursday, October 21, 1999 4:21 PM
Subject: [EQ_Tinkering] re: gnome parties


> From: Andy Smith <AndyS@...>
>
> Seeing all these responses to the party idea, I find myself asking the
> inevitable question: why not do a whole slew of parties? We're all on
> different servers so we can do a monthly gnomefest. Say the first of each
> month (since we're all so short) or if people find it easier to accomodate
> weekend schedules, the first Saturday of the month. Pick a different
server
> every month. Maybe do some dueling competitions, some drunken casting,
some
> minor illusion art etc. Perhaps see just how many level 1 chars it does
> take to kill the mino hero (I'll bet on about 612, provided at least 20
are
> on him at a time)...
>
> Just a thought. Preferably something that doesn't require a lot of
> preparations besides buying an insane amout of alcohol and a little
advance
> warning to the GMs to let them know to expect heavy zone loads.
>
> What would we call it? Gnomapalooza? Gnomestock? Gnomes are not Eunuchs
> (that's one for you Gr0k)?
>
>
